alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding along upper portions of Duck Creek and it`s tributaries. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Duck Creek and it`s tributaries is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated flooding was continuing along Duck Creek and it`s tributaries. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell across the warned area on Friday, and Duck Creek at Macksburg has crested, but only slowly beginning to fall. It crested at about 14-feet, one foot above bankfull this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
